page.title: 15MORTHEN
page.content: { Morthen is a tiny hamlet situated to the east of Whiston.It takes its name from one of the Viking units of administration,"the moorland district with a common assembly".Five farms are closely grouped around the main road,these are mixed farms;arable and milk production.A tiny chapel can be found here.This is dedicated to St.James and is under the control of the Rector of Whiston.Communion is held on the first Sunday of each month and Evensong on every third Sunday of the month.Nearby is the remains of a medievil cross.Morthen Hall is a beautiful example of a typical Georgian style house.It was recently sold for Â£80,000 and as a listed building is protected for the future.Many of the old outhouses have been converted to private houses.
